#summary Guide for installing KB CMS
#labels Featured

= Introduction =

This is a guide to install KB CMS on Ubuntu. Many of the steps may apply to other Ubuntu versions, other distributions or even other operating systems. This guide is specifically made for one certain setup for simplicity, but others may follow later.

= Ubuntu 9.10 (draft instructions) =

{{{
# Add universe and multiverse repositories if not avilable and then update
sudo sed -i 's/^deb \([^ ]*\) \([^ ]*\) main restricted$/deb \1 \2 main restricted universe multiverse/' /etc/apt/sources.list
sudo apt-get update
# Install required packages
sudo apt-get -y install php5 nautilus-script-collection-svn php5-xsl
# Download KB CMS and set it up
sudo chown -R `whoami` /var/www
rm /var/www/index.html
svn checkout http://kbcms.googlecode.com/svn/trunk/ /var/www
}}}


= Ubuntu 7.04 (old instructions, kept for now for reference) =

The initial setup can be done with the following commands in a terminal window:

{{{
# Add universe and multiverse repositories if not avilable and then update
sudo sed -i 's/^deb \([^ ]*\) \([^ ]*\) main restricted$/deb \1 \2 main restricted universe multiverse/' /etc/apt/sources.list
sudo apt-get update
# Install required packages
sudo apt-get -y install php5 nautilus-script-collection-svn php5-xsl
# Download KB CMS and set it up
sudo chown -R `whoami` /var/www
rm -rf /var/www/apache2-default
svn checkout http://kbcms.googlecode.com/svn/trunk/ /var/www
sudo sed -i 's/AllowOverride None/AllowOverride All/g' /etc/apache2/sites-enabled/000-default
sudo ln -s /etc/apache2/mods-available/rewrite.load /etc/apache2/mods-enabled/
sudo /etc/init.d/apache2 restart
}}}

To fix a bug in Apache 2 on the Ubuntu 7.04 live CD, you need to upgrade it:

{{{
sudo apt-get -y install apache2
}}}

The website should now be available at http://localhost. The default website contains a demonstration of how the CMS works.
